name: sort
description:
The sort command sorts OSM features by a tag value or property. Supports:

- Sorting by any tag (name, population, elevation, etc.)
- Sorting by built-in properties (id, lat, lon, type)
- Numeric sorting for numeric values
- Ascending or descending order
- Output limiting

Useful for finding extremes or creating ordered lists.

options.--filter: Filter by tag before sorting (e.g., highway=*)
options.-f, --format: Output format: geojson, json, csv (default: geojson)

output: Sorted features in the specified format, with the sort key included in CSV output.
examples: osmfast sort city.osm --filter place=* --by population --numeric --reverse -n 100 -o top_places.geojson
osmfast sort region.osm --filter natural=peak --by ele --numeric --reverse -n 50 -o highest.geojson
osmfast sort city.osm --filter highway=* --by maxspeed --numeric --reverse -o fast_roads.geojson
osmfast sort city.osm --by name -f csv -o sorted.csv
